doc:
Sydney Howard https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sydney_Howard 0 Sydney Howard (7 August 1884 – 12 June 1946) was an English stage comedian and film actor born in Leeds, West Riding of Yorkshire.Already a major stage star, Howard made his feature film début in Jack Raymond's Splinters (1929), and went on appearing in unique roles in films such as French Leave, Up for the Cup and The Mayor's Nest. Despite his popularity in the 1920s and 1930s films he appeared in, Howard is almost totally forgotten today. His most revived film is When We Are Married, in which he played a drunken photographer.In 1937 British exhibitors voted him the 10th most popular British star at the box office. Sydney_Howard ( 7_August_1884 – 12_June_1946 ) was an_English_stage_comedian_and_film_actor born in Leeds , West_Riding of Yorkshire.Already a_major_stage_star , Howard made his_feature_film_début in Jack_Raymond 's_Splinters ( 1929 ) , and went on appearing in unique_roles in films such_as French_Leave , Up for the_Cup and The_Mayor 's_Nest . Despite his_popularity in the_1920s_and_1930s_films he appeared in , Howard is_almost_totally_forgotten today . His_most_revived_film is When We Are Married , in which he played a_drunken_photographer.In_1937_British_exhibitors voted him the_10th_most_popular_British_star at the_box_office .
